message: The RATIONALE field for indicator 2-2-2b, translated into en
data: Child growth is an internationally accepted outcome reflecting child nutritional status and well-being. Child wasting refers to a child who is too thin for his or her height and is the result of recent rapid weight loss or the failure to gain weight. A child who is moderately or severely wasted has an increased risk of death, but treatment is possible. Child wasting is one of the World Health Assembly nutrition target indicators.
